result.execSummary:
The defendant Randy William Gaffney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs (Oxycodone), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DOC request to review possible duplicate sentence credit.

Defendant Randy William Gaffney in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Randy William Gaffney in custody.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin Dennis Murphy.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered charge amended to dismiss the penalty enhancer.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 60 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for release to the Day Reporting Center ONLY.  NOT ON ELECTRONIC MONITORING OR GPS.

- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, surcharges, and assessments, by 6/12/2015, or serve 10 days in the HOC, consecutive.  Defendant may ask for an extension if not paid in full, and court will grant.

Received and filed:

Pretrial Incarceration Credit.  aw
Defense counsel requests case to come in early for resolution.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 6/12/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  aw

Attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Randy William Gaffney not in court, in custody.  Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for plea and sentencing on 7/17/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Defense counsel to inform the state if defendant needs to be produced for the next court date.  aw  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Randy William Gaffney in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Randy William Gaffney in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Dennis P Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  Absolutely no release from home, GPS monitoring (24 Hour Curfew). ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Randy William Gaffney in court with attorney Jamie F Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Randy William Gaffney in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.
